user_sentiment: Pragmatic and iterative—user accepted the initial solution but immediately identified gaps and specified exact requirements for the next phase, showing they're engaged but the agent missed broader requirements.
execution_quality: Competent execution with some missteps—agent successfully modified search results to fetch and display icons, but the follow-up reveals the solution was incomplete for other UI surfaces (activity details, dashboard), indicating partial understanding of scope.
work_category: UI integration task: replacing placeholder icons with actual app icons in a search interface, requiring component updates across multiple data sources.
summary: Agent made focused progress on the immediate task (adding icons to search) and recovered from a few edit errors, but failed to anticipate the broader feature scope covering multiple UI surfaces with different display requirements. The user's follow-up with 'but not in...' signals the agent solved part of the problem while leaving related surfaces unaddressed, requiring significant additional iteration to meet the full vision.
follow_up_pattern: User is describing a new, more complex feature requirement building on the previous work—they want icons displayed differently across three surfaces (search, details, dashboard) with specific layouts and interaction patterns (eliding, counts, list vs. grid).
